ProvChainOrg
  • REST API Reference
  • View page source

REST API ReferenceÔÉÅ

The ProvChainOrg REST API provides a standard HTTP interface for interacting with the semantic blockchain platform. All endpoints return JSON responses and support standard HTTP methods for CRUD operations.

Base URLÔÉÅ

` http://localhost:8080/api `

AuthenticationÔÉÅ

All API endpoints require authentication using API keys. Include your API key in the request headers:

`http Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY `

API keys can be generated through the web interface or via the CLI:

`bash cargo run -- generate-api-key `

Response FormatÔÉÅ

All API responses follow this JSON structure:

```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {}, ‚Äúmessage‚Äù: ‚ÄúOperation completed successfully‚Äù, ‚Äútimestamp‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:30:00Z‚Äù

}ÔÉÅ

Error ResponsesÔÉÅ

Error responses include detailed information about what went wrong:

```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: false, ‚Äúerror‚Äù: {

‚Äúcode‚Äù: ‚ÄúVALIDATION_ERROR‚Äù, ‚Äúmessage‚Äù: ‚ÄúInvalid RDF data format‚Äù, ‚Äúdetails‚Äù: {

‚Äúfield‚Äù: ‚Äúdata‚Äù, ‚Äúissue‚Äù: ‚ÄúMalformed Turtle syntax‚Äù

}

}, ‚Äútimestamp‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:30:00Z‚Äù

}ÔÉÅ

Status CodesÔÉÅ

Code | Description |

|------|‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-| | 200 | OK - Request successful | | 201 | Created - Resource created successfully | | 400 | Bad Request - Invalid request parameters | | 401 | Unauthorized - Authentication required | | 403 | Forbidden - Insufficient permissions | | 404 | Not Found - Resource not found | | 422 | Unprocessable Entity - Validation failed | | 500 | Internal Server Error - Server error |

EndpointsÔÉÅ

Get the current status of the blockchain.

Endpoint: GET /status

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúblockchain‚Äù: {

‚Äúcurrent_height‚Äù: 42, ‚Äúlatest_block_hash‚Äù: ‚Äú0x4a7b2c8f9e1d3a5b‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äútotal_transactions‚Äù: 156, ‚Äúnetwork_status‚Äù: ‚Äúhealthy‚Äù

}, ‚Äúrdf_store‚Äù: {

‚Äútotal_triples‚Äù: 1247, ‚Äúnamed_graphs‚Äù: 42, ‚Äúquery_performance‚Äù: ‚Äúexcellent‚Äù

}, ‚Äúontology‚Äù: {

‚Äúloaded‚Äù: true, ‚Äúvalidation_enabled‚Äù: true, ‚Äúlast_updated‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:25:00Z‚Äù

}

}

}ÔÉÅ

Add RDF DataÔÉÅ

Add new RDF data as a blockchain block.

Endpoint: POST /data

Headers: ` Content-Type: text/turtle Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY `

Request Body: ```turtle @prefix : <http://example.org/supply-chain#> . @prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

:Batch001 a :ProductBatch ;

:hasBatchID ‚ÄúBATCH-001‚Äù ; :product :OrganicTomatoes ; :harvestDate ‚Äú2025-01-14‚Äù^^xsd:date ; :originFarm :GreenValleyFarm .

```

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúblock_index‚Äù: 43, ‚Äúblock_hash‚Äù: ‚Äú0x8f3e2d1c9b8a7654‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äútimestamp‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:30:15Z‚Äù, ‚Äúvalidation_passed‚Äù: true

}

}ÔÉÅ

Query BlockchainÔÉÅ

Execute a SPARQL query against the blockchain.

Endpoint: POST /query

Headers: ` Content-Type: application/sparql-query Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY `

Request Body: ```sparql PREFIX : <http://example.org/supply-chain#> SELECT ?batch ?product ?farm WHERE {

?batch a :ProductBatch ;

:product ?product ; :originFarm ?farm .

}ÔÉÅ

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúquery_type‚Äù: ‚ÄúSELECT‚Äù, ‚Äúresult_count‚Äù: 3, ‚Äúresults‚Äù: [

{

‚Äúbatch‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://example.org/supply-chain#Batch001‚Äù, ‚Äúproduct‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://example.org/supply-chain#OrganicTomatoes‚Äù, ‚Äúfarm‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://example.org/supply-chain#GreenValleyFarm‚Äù

}, {

‚Äúbatch‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://example.org/supply-chain#Batch002‚Äù, ‚Äúproduct‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://example.org/supply-chain#OrganicCarrots‚Äù, ‚Äúfarm‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://example.org/supply-chain#SunnyMeadowFarm‚Äù

}

]

}

}ÔÉÅ

Get BlockÔÉÅ

Retrieve a specific block by its index.

Endpoint: GET /blocks/{index}

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúindex‚Äù: 42, ‚Äútimestamp‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:25:00Z‚Äù, ‚Äúprevious_hash‚Äù: ‚Äú0x1a2b3c4d5e6f7890‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äúhash‚Äù: ‚Äú0x4a7b2c8f9e1d3a5b‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúgraph_name‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://provchain.org/block/42‚Äù, ‚Äúturtle_data‚Äù: ‚Äú@prefix : <http://example.org/supply-chain#> .n:Batch001 a :ProductBatch ;‚Äù, ‚Äútriple_count‚Äù: 15

}

}

}ÔÉÅ

Get BlocksÔÉÅ

Retrieve a range of blocks with pagination.

Endpoint: GET /blocks

Query Parameters: - limit (optional, default: 10) - Number of blocks to return - offset (optional, default: 0) - Starting block index - format (optional, default: ‚Äúsummary‚Äù) - Response format: ‚Äúsummary‚Äù or ‚Äúfull‚Äù

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúpagination‚Äù: {

‚Äúlimit‚Äù: 10, ‚Äúoffset‚Äù: 0, ‚Äútotal_blocks‚Äù: 42

}, ‚Äúblocks‚Äù: [

{

‚Äúindex‚Äù: 42, ‚Äútimestamp‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:25:00Z‚Äù, ‚Äúhash‚Äù: ‚Äú0x4a7b2c8f9e1d3a5b‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äútriple_count‚Äù: 15

}, {

‚Äúindex‚Äù: 41, ‚Äútimestamp‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:20:00Z‚Äù, ‚Äúhash‚Äù: ‚Äú0x8f3e2d1c9b8a7654‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äútriple_count‚Äù: 12

}

]

}

}ÔÉÅ

Validate BlockchainÔÉÅ

Validate the integrity of the blockchain.

Endpoint: POST /validate

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúis_valid‚Äù: true, ‚Äútotal_blocks‚Äù: 42, ‚Äúvalidation_time_ms‚Äù: 245, ‚Äúissues‚Äù: []

}

}ÔÉÅ

Export DataÔÉÅ

Export blockchain data in various formats.

Endpoint: GET /export

Query Parameters: - format (required) - Export format: ‚Äúturtle‚Äù, ‚Äújsonld‚Äù, ‚Äúntriples‚Äù, ‚Äúrdfxml‚Äù - graph (optional) - Specific named graph to export - compression (optional) - Compression: ‚Äúgzip‚Äù, ‚Äúnone‚Äù

Response: Content-Type depends on the requested format.

Example (Turtle): ```turtle @prefix : <http://example.org/supply-chain#> . @prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

:Batch001 a :ProductBatch ;

:hasBatchID ‚ÄúBATCH-001‚Äù ; :product :OrganicTomatoes ; :harvestDate ‚Äú2025-01-14‚Äù^^xsd:date .

```

Get OntologyÔÉÅ

Retrieve the current ontology configuration.

Endpoint: GET /ontology

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúloaded‚Äù: true, ‚Äúpath‚Äù: ‚Äúontology/traceability.owl.ttl‚Äù, ‚Äúgraph_name‚Äù: ‚Äúhttp://provchain.org/ontology‚Äù, ‚Äúvalidation_enabled‚Äù: true, ‚Äúlast_updated‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:25:00Z‚Äù, ‚Äúclasses‚Äù: [

‚ÄúProductBatch‚Äù, ‚ÄúProcessingActivity‚Äù, ‚ÄúEnvironmentalCondition‚Äù

]

}

}ÔÉÅ

Validate RDF DataÔÉÅ

Validate RDF data against the loaded ontology.

Endpoint: POST /ontology/validate

Headers: ` Content-Type: text/turtle Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY `

Request Body: ```turtle @prefix : <http://example.org/supply-chain#> .

:Batch001 a :ProductBatch ;

:hasBatchID ‚ÄúTEST-BATCH‚Äù .

```

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúis_valid‚Äù: true, ‚Äúvalidation_time_ms‚Äù: 45, ‚Äúissues‚Äù: []

}

}ÔÉÅ

Network InformationÔÉÅ

Get information about the P2P network.

Endpoint: GET /network

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúnode_id‚Äù: ‚Äúprovchain-node-001‚Äù, ‚Äúis_authority‚Äù: false, ‚Äúconnected_peers‚Äù: 3, ‚Äúknown_peers‚Äù: [

{

‚Äúid‚Äù: ‚Äúpeer-001‚Äù, ‚Äúaddress‚Äù: ‚Äú192.168.1.100:8080‚Äù, ‚Äúlast_seen‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:28:00Z‚Äù

}

], ‚Äúnetwork_status‚Äù: ‚Äúhealthy‚Äù

}

}ÔÉÅ

Rate LimitingÔÉÅ

API endpoints are rate limited to prevent abuse:

  • Authentication endpoints: 5 requests per minute

  • Read endpoints: 100 requests per minute

  • Write endpoints: 10 requests per minute

  • Query endpoints: 50 requests per minute

Rate limit headers are included in responses:

`http X-RateLimit-Limit: 100 X-RateLimit-Remaining: 95 X-RateLimit-Reset: 1642125600 `

WebhooksÔÉÅ

Subscribe to blockchain events via webhooks.

Endpoint: POST /webhooks

Request Body: ```json {

‚Äúurl‚Äù: ‚Äúhttps://your-app.com/webhooks/provchain‚Äù, ‚Äúevents‚Äù: [‚Äúnew_block‚Äù, ‚Äúvalidation_error‚Äù, ‚Äúnetwork_change‚Äù], ‚Äúsecret‚Äù: ‚Äúyour-webhook-secret‚Äù

}ÔÉÅ

Response: ```json {

‚Äúsuccess‚Äù: true, ‚Äúdata‚Äù: {

‚Äúwebhook_id‚Äù: ‚Äúwh_123456789‚Äù, ‚Äúurl‚Äù: ‚Äúhttps://your-app.com/webhooks/provchain‚Äù, ‚Äúevents‚Äù: [‚Äúnew_block‚Äù, ‚Äúvalidation_error‚Äù, ‚Äúnetwork_change‚Äù], ‚Äúcreated_at‚Äù: ‚Äú2025-01-14T18:30:00Z‚Äù

}

}ÔÉÅ

Example UsageÔÉÅ

```bash # Get blockchain status curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/api/status

-H ‚ÄúAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY‚Äù

# Add RDF data curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/api/data

-H ‚ÄúContent-Type: text/turtle‚Äù -H ‚ÄúAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY‚Äù -d ‚Äú@/path/to/data.ttl‚Äù

# Execute SPARQL query curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/api/query

-H ‚ÄúContent-Type: application/sparql-query‚Äù -H ‚ÄúAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY‚Äù -d ‚ÄúSELECT ?batch ?product WHERE { ?batch a :ProductBatch ; :product ?product }‚Äù

```

Try the Status API

Method: GET

URL: http://localhost:8080/api/status

Headers: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

# Response will appear here

```python import requests import json

class ProvChainAPI:
def __init__(self, base_url, api_key):

self.base_url = base_url self.headers = {

‚ÄúAuthorization‚Äù: f‚ÄùBearer {api_key}‚Äù, ‚ÄúContent-Type‚Äù: ‚Äúapplication/json‚Äù

}

def get_status(self):

response = requests.get(f‚Äù{self.base_url}/status‚Äù, headers=self.headers) return response.json()

def add_rdf_data(self, turtle_data):

headers = self.headers.copy() headers[‚ÄúContent-Type‚Äù] = ‚Äútext/turtle‚Äù response = requests.post(f‚Äù{self.base_url}/data‚Äù, headers=headers, data=turtle_data) return response.json()

def execute_query(self, sparql_query):

headers = self.headers.copy() headers[‚ÄúContent-Type‚Äù] = ‚Äúapplication/sparql-query‚Äù response = requests.post(f‚Äù{self.base_url}/query‚Äù, headers=headers, data=sparql_query) return response.json()

# Usage api = ProvChainAPI(‚Äùhttp://localhost:8080/api‚Äù, ‚ÄúYOUR_API_KEY‚Äù) status = api.get_status() print(f‚ÄùBlockchain height: {status[‚Äòdata‚Äô][‚Äòblockchain‚Äô][‚Äòcurrent_height‚Äô]}‚Äù)

# Add data rdf_data = ‚Äú‚Äù‚Äù @prefix : <http://example.org/supply-chain#> . :Batch001 a :ProductBatch ; :hasBatchID ‚ÄúTEST-001‚Äù . ‚Äú‚Äù‚Äù result = api.add_rdf_data(rdf_data) print(f‚ÄùAdded block: {result[‚Äòdata‚Äô][‚Äòblock_index‚Äô]}‚Äù) ```

```javascript class ProvChainAPI {

constructor(baseUrl, apiKey) {

this.baseUrl = baseUrl; this.headers = {

‚ÄòAuthorization‚Äô: Bearer ${apiKey}, ‚ÄòContent-Type‚Äô: ‚Äòapplication/json‚Äô

};

}

async getStatus() {
const response = await fetch(${this.baseUrl}/status, {

headers: this.headers

}); return await response.json();

}

async addRDFData(turtleData) {

const headers = { ‚Ä¶this.headers }; headers[‚ÄòContent-Type‚Äô] = ‚Äòtext/turtle‚Äô;

const response = await fetch(${this.baseUrl}/data, {

method: ‚ÄòPOST‚Äô, headers: headers, body: turtleData

}); return await response.json();

}

async executeQuery(sparqlQuery) {

const headers = { ‚Ä¶this.headers }; headers[‚ÄòContent-Type‚Äô] = ‚Äòapplication/sparql-query‚Äô;

const response = await fetch(${this.baseUrl}/query, {

method: ‚ÄòPOST‚Äô, headers: headers, body: sparqlQuery

}); return await response.json();

}

}

// Usage const api = new ProvChainAPI(‚Äôhttp://localhost:8080/api‚Äô, ‚ÄòYOUR_API_KEY‚Äô);

api.getStatus().then(status => {

console.log(Blockchain height: ${status.data.blockchain.current_height});

});

const rdfData = @prefix : <http://example.org/supply-chain#> . :Batch001 a :ProductBatch ; :hasBatchID ‚ÄúTEST-001‚Äù .;

api.addRDFData(rdfData).then(result => {

console.log(Added block: ${result.data.block_index});

});ÔÉÅ

Best PracticesÔÉÅ

  1. Error Handling: Always check the success field in responses and handle errors appropriately.

  2. Rate Limiting: Monitor rate limit headers and implement exponential backoff for failed requests.

  3. Authentication: Store API keys securely and never expose them in client-side code.

  4. Batch Operations: For bulk operations, consider implementing client-side batching to reduce API calls.

  5. Caching: Cache frequently accessed data like blockchain status to reduce API calls.

  6. Webhooks: Use webhooks for real-time updates instead of polling for new blocks.

  7. Validation: Always validate data on the client side before sending to the API.

  8. Monitoring: Implement logging and monitoring for API usage and errors.

TroubleshootingÔÉÅ

Authentication Failed

  • Verify your API key is correct and not expired

  • Check that the Authorization header is properly formatted

Rate Limit Exceeded

  • Wait for the rate limit to reset (check X-RateLimit-Reset header)

  • Implement exponential backoff in your client

Invalid RDF Data

  • Validate your Turtle syntax before sending

  • Check that all required properties are included

Query Timeout

  • Optimize your SPARQL queries

  • Use LIMIT clauses for large result sets

Network Connection Issues

  • Verify the ProvChainOrg node is running

  • Check firewall settings and network connectivity

  • API Documentation: Refer to this documentation for detailed endpoint information

  • GitHub Issues: Report bugs and request features

  • Community Support: Join discussions for help and best practices

  • Support Email: For enterprise customers, contact support@provchain-org.com
